009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * This is an implementation of the global thresholder proposed by Ridler and
015 * Calvard [1]. See Sec. 9.1.3 (Alg. 9.3) of [2] for a detailed description.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] T.W. Ridler, S. Calvard, Picture thresholding using an iterative
019 * selection method, IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics, SMC-8
020 * (August 1978) 630-632. <br>
021 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
022 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/04/02
027 */
028public class IsodataThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
029        
030        private int MAX_ITERATIONS = 100;
031
032        private double[] M0 = null;             // table of background means
033        private double[] M1 = null;             // table of foreground means
034        
035        public IsodataThresholder() {
036                super();
037        }
038
039        @Override
040        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
041                makeMeanTables(h);
042                int K = h.length;
043                int q = (int) M0[K-1];  // start with total mean
044                int q_;
045                
046                int i = 0;
047                do {
048                        i++; 
049                        if (M0[q] < 0 || M1[q] < 0)  // background or foreground is empty
050                                return -1;
051                        q_ = q;                         
052                        q = (int) ((M0[q] + M1[q]) / 2);
053                } while (q != q_ && i < MAX_ITERATIONS);
054                
055                return q;
056        }
057        
058        private void makeMeanTables(int[] h) {
059                int K = h.length;
060                M0 = new double[K];
061                M1 = new double[K];
062                
063                int n0 = 0;
064                long s0 = 0;
065                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
066                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
067                        s0 = s0 + q * h[q];
068                        M0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? ((double) s0)/n0 : -1;
069                }
070//              int N = n0;
071                
072                int n1 = 0;
073                long s1 = 0;
074                M1[K-1] = 0;
075                for (int q = h.length-2; q >= 0; q--) {
076                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
077                        s1 = s1 + (q+1) * h[q+1];
078                        M1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? ((double) s1)/n1 : -1;
079                }
080                
081//              return N;
082        }
083        
084}
